remarks: "Bocardo", one of the syllogisms of Aristotelian logic.  Some ` ph ` is not ` ps ` , and all ` ph ` is ` ch ` , therefore some ` ch ` is not ` ps ` .  (In Aristotelian notation, OAO-3:  MoP and MaS therefore SoP.) For example, "Some cats have no tails", "All cats are mammals", therefore "Some mammals have no tails".  A reorder of ~ disamis ; prefer using that instead.  (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 28-Aug-2016.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement:
bocardo.maj $e |- E. x ( ph /\ -. ps ) $.
bocardo.min $e |- A. x ( ph -> ch ) $.
bocardo $p |- E. x ( ch /\ -. ps ) $.
